alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 2:49AM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter Weather Returns through Early Tuesday... .Another weather system will bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal early this week. The heaviest snow will occur over the foothills and mountains north of Redding from early this morning into the evening and over Plumas county and the Lassen park area above 4,000 feet tonight and Tuesday. Significant travel impacts will be possible on Interstate 5 north of Redding. Lighter snowfall accumulations will impact travel over the Northern Sierra Interstate 80 and Highway 50 tonight into Tuesday. Strong winds will also accompany this weather system and could cause limited visibility at times as well as downed tree branches and weakened trees. The strongest winds will be over Plumas county above 4,000 feet where gusts up to 65 mph will be possible causing downed trees and power lines. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early this week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Downed trees and power lines possible due to heavy snow and strong winds. Wind gusts from 55 to 65 mph possible. Visibility near zero at times in heavy snow and strong winds. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with localized amounts up to 2 feet, are expected. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park. * WHEN...10 AM today to 7 AM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for wet snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
